summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons chain of custody log documenting the discovery and initial handling of 'AED Pads' found in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death. The evidence was transferred to Health Services and the SIS Office.

persons.name: Jeffery Edward Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the 'SUSPECT' associated with the evidence (AED pads) found in the Special Housing Unit where he died.

events.title: Discovery of AED Pads in SHU
events.description: Automated External Defibrillator (AED) pads were found in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the J-Range at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 10:00 a.m.

events.title: Evidence Transfer to Health Services and SIS
events.description: The AED pad evidence was released from custody at 10:00 a.m. to Health Services and at 10:15 a.m. to the SIS (Special Investigative Services) Office.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (inferred location of Special Housing Unit)
keyFacts: AED (Automated External Defibrillator) pads were found in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 12, 2019, at 10:00 a.m.
The evidence was discovered the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The evidence log lists Jeffrey Epstein as the 'SUSPECT' associated with the found AED pads.
The evidence was transferred to both Health Services and the SIS (Special Investigative Services) Office for analysis.
The document is a formal chain of custody log, indicating the evidence was handled as part of a post-death investigation.
